briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Quadruple Therapy in Eradication of H. Pylori: A Comparison to Triple Therapy

armGroups.label: OBMT 10 days
interventionNames: Drug: Pylera (Bismuth subcitrate potassium, metronidazole, tetracycline) given in combination with omeprazole

interventions.name: Pylera (Bismuth subcitrate potassium, metronidazole, tetracycline) given in combination with omeprazole

outcomeMeasures.title: Helicobacter Pylori Eradication Confirmed by Urea Breath Test
outcomeMeasures.description: H. pylori Eradication defined as a negative C13-UBT (urea breath test) result at both Week 6 and Week 10 follow-up visits.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients Experiencing Treatment Emergent Adverse Events.
outcomeMeasures.description:
A treatment-emergent adverse event is defined as an event not present prior to exposure to the study medication or any event already present that worsens in either intensity or frequency following exposure to study medication up to 30 days after study discontinuation.

All safety analysis based on the safety population.

outcomeMeasures.title: H. Pylori Eradication and Presence or Past History of Peptic Ulcers
outcomeMeasures.description: Eradication rates in the subset of patients with peptic ulcer (current or past history) at baseline are reported based on the per protocol population. Eradication must be confirmed at week 6 and week 10 by a negative Urea Breath Test conducted within the allocated windows.

outcomeMeasures.title: Clarithromycin Resistance
outcomeMeasures.description: Eradication rates in subset of patients infected with a bacterial strain confirmed as resistant to clarithromycin at baseline. Resistance to clarithromycin defined as Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) of 1 ug/ml and above

outcomeMeasures.title: Metronidazole Resistance
outcomeMeasures.description: Eradication rates in subset of patients infected with a bacterial strain confirmed as resistant to metronidazole at baseline. Resistance to metronidazole defined as Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) above 8 ug/ml

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Compliance to Study Medications
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall compliance: number of capsules dispensed - number of capsules returned/Number of prescribed capsules X 100. Percentages based on safety population

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With Bismuth Plasma Concentrations Above the Toxic Level
outcomeMeasures.description: Tolerability of OBMT with respect to plasma bismuth concentrations: number of patients with bismuth concentrations above the toxic level (50 ug per liter)
